fields.title: Incorrect recording of cash
fields.desc:
Cash receipts:
- Have been recorded (when there are non-existent cash receipts), or have been improperly recorded
- Have not been recorded/applied
- Are not accurately recorded.

fields.title: Bank account not reflected in GL
fields.desc: Cash exists in bank accounts that have not been recorded in the general ledger.

fields.title: New or modified bank accounts
fields.desc: Not all bank accounts have been recorded in the general ledger.

fields.title: Bank accounts do not reconcile
fields.desc: Cash stated in the general ledger does not reconcile to the cash records/bank statement, and/or the reconciliation contains invalid items.

fields.title: Fixed assets not recorded
fields.desc: Acquisitions of fixed assets are not recorded.

fields.title: Check cash receipts
fields.desc: On a daily basis, cash receipts recorded to the general ledger are agreed to bank deposit slips by accounting personnel. Discrepancies are investigated and resolved. (Preventative)

fields.title: Reconcile bank statements
fields.desc: Bank statements are reconciled to the general ledger regularly and differences are investigated and resolved on a timely basis. (Detective)

fields.title: Review bank transactions
fields.desc: Accounts personnel record bank account transactions to the general ledger on a daily basis; Accounts Manager (Management) reviews recorded transactions and cash position regularly for unusual activity and investigates and resolves issues on a timely basis. (Preventative)

fields.title: Reconcile bank statements
fields.desc: Bank statements are reconciled to the general ledger regularly and differences are investigated and resolved on a timely basis. (Detective)

fields.title: Approve new bank accounts
fields.desc: New bank accounts are only opened through the direction and approval of Board of Directors. When new bank accounts are approved and opened, finance personnel create the general ledger account and prepare the journal entry to record the initial balance in the account. Management reviews and approves the new general ledger account and journal entry, including supporting documentation, before the journal entry is recorded. (Preventative)

fields.title: Check existing bank accounts
fields.desc: Finance Manager with knowledge of existing and terminated bank accounts reviews the listing of bank accounts recorded in the general ledger and the related account transactions. Any unusual or omitted accounts are investigated and resolved on a timely basis. (Detective)

fields.title: Check cash suspense accounts
fields.desc: Finance personnel analyse amounts recorded to cash suspense accounts and prepare journal entries to correct any unusual items. Management reviews and approves the journal entries and supporting analysis before the journal entry is recorded. (Preventative)

fields.title: Check bank accounts reconciliation
fields.desc: Bank statements are reconciled to the general ledger regularly and differences are investigated and resolved on a timely basis. (Detective)

fields.title: 3-way match to record Fixed assets
fields.desc: A 3-way match process is performed for fixed assets purchases that utilise the purchase order, receiving document, and vendor invoice. Once the 3-way match process is performed and the key terms of the purchase are agreed to supporting documentation, a transaction is posted in the fixed assets sub-ledger and general ledger to record the addition. (Preventative)

fields.title: Periodic checks of Fixed Assets inventory
fields.desc: Periodic counts of fixed assets are performed. Selections are made from the floor and reconciled to the fixed assets register, and any differences are investigated and resolved. (Detective)
